description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger, per Mach and Ormsby. Physical description: 20 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on glazed, laid Arabic paper. Rubrication and catchwords. Marginal damp staining throughout manuscript which encroaches on text on leaves 1-35. Origin: Text originally completed 22 Rajab 996 H [17 June 1588] (leaf 151b). This copy is likely 17th century. Incipit: لك الحمد يا ذو الجود والمجد والعلي
author: Jābalqī, ʻAbd al-ʻAlī ibn Maḥmūd, active 16th century
abstract: Commentary on al-Shahīd al-Awwal's Alfīyah fī al-ṣalāh al-yawmīyah.
creator: Jābalqī, ʻAbd al-ʻAlī ibn Maḥmūd, active 16th century
جابلقي، عبد العلي بن محمود، active 16th century
subject: Shahīd al-Awwal, Muḥammad ibn Makkī, 1333 or 1334-1380—Alfīyah fī al-ṣalāh al-yawmīyah
binding_note: Loose in folder which used to be a cover for Byron's Poetical Works, Volume II.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
